TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
You know, those could be used for a Bigelow like space station with porkjet's habitation modules.

I've tried to make them more Mir-alike, based on the 3-view I found. And I guess they can be used for most of Soviet-like station design.

I've tried to make them more Mir-alike, based on the 3-view I found. And I guess they can be used for most of Soviet-like station design.

But Bigelow aerospace is american.

LOK test! Ships: Tantares, Launcher: NovaPunch2, Fairings: KWRocketry.

If Tantares pack was a girl I'd marry her!

http://imgur.com/a/nqwCQ

The best gallery I've seen, really made my day! (Really nice details around the LOK docking port)

Definitely going to do this myself when I have a chance (Got the SXT N1 on standby...)

Can I ask what graphics mods you are using?

Definitely going to do this myself when I have a chance (Got the SXT N1 on standby...)

Not to be rude, I really love Lack's work on SXT (and I'm personally thankful to him for helping me with Blender and Unity), but the engines on its N1 are kinda unbalanced, so I'd recommend the one from NovaPunch2 pack.

@Beale

The "Farshot" has no ModuleGimbal, is that right?

But beside that, a really nice engine you made there.

Not to be rude, I really love Lack's work on SXT (and I'm personally thankful to him for helping me with Blender and Unity), but the engines on its N1 are kinda unbalanced, so I'd recommend the one from NovaPunch2 pack.

Hmm, really? I'll be sure to give it a try. I've only used the SXT one so far due to RAM issues.

@Beale

The "Farshot" has no ModuleGimbal, is that right?

But beside that, a really nice engine you made there.

Thanks

It does lack ModuleGimbal on purpose, though I'm open to feedback on this

I reckon that the engine should have had some drawback (In general it's better than the standard Tantares OMS in every way).

What do people think? Gimbal or no Gimbal?

Gimbal or no Gimbal?

I really don't know if its necessary.

I just noticed after checking the config because most engines have the module.

Gimbal or no Gimbal?

No Gimbal, obviously - it's orbital engine.

Can I ask what graphics mods you are using?

EVE + Astronomer's Pack v5 + Texture Replacer + Specialists Suits.

What do people think? Gimbal or no Gimbal?

No, I think everything is fine with it, gimbal isn't much needed for service modules. Also, I feel a bit greedy to ask, but docking ports with radial attachment will be great for building stations.

Edited September 12, 2014 by Niemand303

EVE + Astronomer's Pack v5 + Texture Replacer + Specialists Suits.
No, I think everything is fine with it, gimbal isn't much needed for service modules. Also, I feel a bit greedy to ask, but docking ports with radial attachment will be great for building stations.

Thanks for the graphical configs

I imagine the ports (well, only the female one) will be made radial some point soon. The models need a "tube" that stretches from the bottom (like the stock ports), so that's what is holding me off at this point.

Also from the feedback I guess a Gimbal update isn't needed.

Edited September 12, 2014 by Beale

Nice and thanks... (8.0)

Test "R-7" and HAMAL "nuclear warhead"...

Thanks

It does lack ModuleGimbal on purpose, though I'm open to feedback on this

I reckon that the engine should have had some drawback (In general it's better than the standard Tantares OMS in every way).

0.25 degree gimbal.

Oh man Beale, every time I start to think about role-playing a super modern/futuristic game of Kerbal you release something awesome that keeps me firmly rooted in the Soviet/Russia heyday of space travel.

To Duna with LOK!

Quick question: What are the things sticking out on the sides of farshot engine? And where are they located in the ship building menu?

They're the 500km Remote Tech 2 Antennas!

Oh man Beale, every time I start to think about role-playing a super modern/futuristic game of Kerbal you release something awesome that keeps me firmly rooted in the Soviet/Russia heyday of space travel.

Hobbyists today drive classic cars. Hobbyists tomorrow drive classic spaceships, role-play away!

Minor question (NO NEED to hurry & fix this at once):

Tantares_Orbital_A has no ModuleCommand for a reason?

The real Soyuz Orbital module can't operate by itself and it's depressurized after release. So I don't think it should to be honest. Shenzou orbital module can, on the other hand.

Hope this answers you

Speaking of shenzou, is there any chance that the shenzou OM will be made?

Speaking of shenzou, is there any chance that the shenzou OM will be made?

I personally find it better looking.

Speaking of shenzou, is there any chance that the shenzou OM will be made?

Or the PPTS.
PPTS Is a good Idea. I love it
Yeah a PPTS would be awesome

Or the PPTS.
PPTS Is a good Idea. I love it
Yeah a PPTS would be awesome

I see the enthusiasm, but the PPTS is not really workable in stock sizes (Including 1.875m) to be in proportion. This is why I've kinda held off it.

If someone can suggest me a way it can be done (in the right proportion whilst sticking to standard port sizes), then sure I'd like to make the PPTS.

Actually, it looks to be possible using a 2.5m base, could be done at some point!

Edited September 13, 2014 by Beale
